dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1147 RH: Whole Milk for Healthy Kids Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania (for himself, Ms. Schrier, Mr. Fulcher, Mr. Balderson, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Trone, Mr. Austin Scott of Georgia, Mr. Meuser, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Smucker, Mr. Cartwright, Mr. Banks, Mr. Baird, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Reschenthaler, Mr. Perry, Mr. Simpson, Mr. McClintock, Mr. Mann, Mr. Cloud, Mr. Kelly of Mississippi, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, Ms. Slotkin, Mr. Steil, Ms. Stefanik, Mr. Ryan, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Fitzgerald, Mr. Barr, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. Tonko, Ms. Spanberger, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Gallagher, Mr. Feenstra, Mr. Joyce of Pennsylvania, and Mr. Cline) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

Additional sponsors: Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Cuellar, Mr. Alford, Mr. Grothman, Mr. Van Orden, Ms. De La Cruz, Mr. Vasquez, Mr. Harder of California, Mr. Molinaro, Mr. Courtney, Mrs. Hayes, Ms. Letlow, Mr. Rose, Mr. Good of Virginia, Mr. Costa, Ms. Hageman, Mr. Golden of Maine, Mrs. Lesko, Ms. Tokuda, Mr. Walberg, Mr. Sessions, Mr. Williams of New York, Mr. Langworthy, Mr. Crawford, Mr. Stauber, Mrs. Hinson, Mr. Smith of Missouri, Mr. Comer, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Ms. Pingree, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. DesJarlais, Mr. Pfluger, Mr. Carter of Texas, Mrs. McClain, Ms. Granger, Mr. Murphy, Mrs. Cammack, Mr. Estes, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Lucas, Mr. Van Drew, Mr. Miller of Ohio, Mrs. Chavez-DeRemer, Mr. Bost, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Nunn of Iowa, Mr. Finstad, Mr. Duarte, Mr. Owens, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, Mrs. Fischbach, Mr. Carl, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Mr. Lawler, Mr. Moran, Mr. Steube, Mr. Davis of North Carolina, Mr. Allen, Mrs. Houchin, Ms. Wild, Mr. C. Scott Franklin of Florida, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Schweikert, Mr. Jackson of Illinois, Ms. Craig, Mr. Armstrong, Ms. Mace, Mr. Amodei, Mr. Self, Mr. Waltz, Mrs. Miller of West Virginia, Mr. McHenry, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mr. Pence, Mr. Posey, Mr. Ferguson, Mr. Williams of Texas, Mr. Dunn of Florida, Mr. Panetta, Ms. DelBene, Mr. Hern, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Bentz, Mr. Lamborn, Ms. Malliotakis, Ms. Kuster, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Deluzio, Mr. Mills, Mr. LaTurner, and Ms. Caraveo
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on February 21, 2023

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to allow schools that participate in the school lunch program under such Act to serve whole milk.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Whole Milk for Healthy Kids Act of 2023.
Section 9(a)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1758(a)(2)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by amending subparagraph (A) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: Lunches served by schools participating in the school lunch program under this Actâ€”

clause.text: shall offer students a variety of fluid milk;
may offer students flavored and unflavored whole, reduced-fat, low-fat and fat-free fluid milk and lactose-free fluid milk; and

shall provide a substitute for fluid milk for students whose disability restricts their diet, on receipt of a written statement from a licensed physician that identifies the disability that restricts the studentâ€™s diet and that specifies the substitute for fluid milk.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Milk fat included in any fluid milk provided under subparagraph (A) shall not be considered saturated fat for purposes of measuring compliance with the allowable average saturated fat content of a meal under section 210.10 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations).

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
